plugins.name: TypeGrid
plugins.description:
TypeGrid allows you to:

  1. Generate a typescale: Choose your base font size, ratio, and number of steps, and the plugin instantly creates a preview of your typescale.
  2. Apply a baseline grid: Set your baseline unit and rounding mode, and the plugin ensures your text layers align perfectly to the grid.
  3. Create text layers: With a single click, generate text layers for each step in your typescale, automatically named and styled.
  4. Create text styles: Generate Figma text styles for each step in your typescale, making it easy to apply consistent typography throughout your design.
  5. Preview with custom fonts: See how your typescale looks with any font installed on your system, including different weights.
  6. Fine-tune your settings: Adjust your typescale and baseline grid settings in real-time to get the perfect look for your design.
  7. Save time and ensure consistency: Automate the tedious process of creating and managing typescales and baseline grids, saving you time and ensuring consistency across your designs.
plugins.tagline: Streamline typography with typescale previews, text styles, and a consistent baseline grid.

plugins.name: Styles Manager
plugins.description:
Effortless Style Management in Figma


Take full control of your colors, text styles, effects, and grids with Styles Manager – the ultimate tool for organizing, duplicating, and editing styles in Figma. No more manual copying or messy style structures – streamline your workflow and keep everything structured in just a few clicks!


Bulk Duplicate Folders & Styles

  1. Preserve the original hierarchy when duplicating styles and folders.
  2. Keep all Variables links intact for a seamless workflow.


Batch Selection & Actions

  1. Select multiple styles within a folder and apply actions at once.
  2. Duplicate or delete entire groups of styles instantly.


Full Control Over Text Styles

  1. Easily rename, duplicate, and delete text styles.
  2. Maintain the folder structure while working with multiple styles.


Instant Effect Type Recognition

  1. Identify Drop Shadows, Blurs, and Inner Shadows at a glance.
  2. Edit and organize effect styles as easily as colors and fonts.


Manage Grid Styles Efficiently

  1. Quickly duplicate, remove, or organize grid styles while preserving settings.
  2. Select multiple grid styles at once for bulk actions.


Why Use Styles Manager?


  1. Saves time by automating repetitive tasks.
  2. Keeps everything structured – no more lost or unorganized styles.
  3. Ensures consistency across projects with preserved Variables and hierarchy.


Upgrade your workflow and take full control of your Figma styles today!

plugins.name: Button States Generator
plugins.description:
Enhance your design workflow with the Button States Generator and create consistent, accessible button components effortlessly.


Overview


The Button States Generator is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the creation of button components with multiple states: Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.


Features


- Dynamic Button Creation: Generate button components with customizable dimensions, radius, paddings & colors

- State Variants: Automatically create and manage button states including Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.

- Color Customization: Easily adjust each state colors, with options to randomize or reset to default.

- Contrast Checker: Built-in contrast checker ensures your design meets WCAG standards for accessibility.

- Icon Placement Options: Choose from multiple icon placement options (none, left, right, or icon-only) as a component property.


How to Use


Assuming you already have your button design ready:


1. Select button Frame: Start by selecting the frame of your button.

2. Customize Settings (optional): Use the plugin's UI to adjust dimensions, colors, and other settings if necessary.

3. Choose Icon Placement (optional): Select the icon placement option from the dropdown menu (none, left, right, or icon-only).

4. Generate Components: Click 'Create Component' to generate the button variants.


Note: This will not work if you select a pre-existing component. If your button is a component, detach it to convert it into a Frame.


Component Properties


The generated button component includes these useful properties:


- States: Choose between Default, Hover, Focus, Selected, and Disabled states

- Icon: Control icon placement (None, Left, Right, Only)

- Colors: Adjust text and background colors for each state

- Dimensions: Fine-tune sizing, radius and padding


Support


For any questions or support, please contact luc.hespel@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Generate Button component with variants / states instantly

plugins.name: Handoff
plugins.description:
Design 🤝 Dev Handoff


Design to dev done right. A Figma plugin to turn design variabes + styles into Tailwind & POSTCSS.


Learn more on Github.


Features


- Convert Figma variables + styles to Tailwind config variables

- Convert Figma text styles to POSTCSS syntax with responsive media queries

- Consolidate design + dev tokens into one source of truth, extensible by designers and developers


Usage


1. Install the plugin from the Figma Community

2. Open the plugin from the Figma toolbar

3. Generate handoff files (.json and .postcss) from the plugin

4. Pass files to developers to integrate into their Tailwind config and Tailwind `@component` layers


Text Styles


The plugin will convert Figma text styles to POSTCSS syntax with responsive media queries. The plugin will also generate a JSON file with the font sizes. The plugin is opinionated as to what gets converted to a class, so it's recommended to review the generated POSTCSS file and adjust as needed.


The POSTCSS file will work from the smallest breakpoint to the largest, assigning media queries using Tailwind's `screen` function as breakpoints appear. Properties are diffed to the base style and only novel properties are added to the media query.

.body-1 {
font-family: Inter;
font-size: 16px;
line-height: 24px;
font-weight: 400;
letter-spacing: 0.5px;

@media screen(md) {
font-size: 2.75rem;
}

@media screen(lg) {
font-size: 3.5rem;
}
}


Naming Schema


The naming schema works so that we capture only the most important classes. For the sake of brevity, we only capture the default classes, defined as not having any variants or as being named the `default` variant.


{viewport}/{style}/{variant}


- `viewport` - The viewport size in Tailwind syntax (e.g. `sm`, `md`, `lg`, `xl`). This corresponds directly to the `Screens` variables, so a matching entry should exist in that variable collection.

- `style` - The Figma text style name, such as `display-1` or `body-3`. This is semantic and can be named anything, but it should be consistent across the design system. The styles for this should be the _default_ styles, as in the most common styles used in the design system for this type of text.

- `variant` - The variant of the style in semantic or property synax, such as `bold`, `italic`, `uppercase`, `lowercase`, `capitalize`, `normal`, `underline`, `line-through`, `no-underline`. This is optional and can be omitted if the style does not have a variant. NOTE: A `default` style MUST be named here in order to be converted to POSTCSS (ex: `md/body-3/default`).


Variables


The plugin will convert Figma variables and effects styles to Tailwind config variables via a resulting JSON file matching the Tailwind configuration. The plugin is optimized to account for a few key properties such as `screens`, `spacing`, `backdropBlur`, `blur`, `borderRadius`, etc, which are numbers converted specially to corresponding formats. The ability to customize a properties format is in the works. Need it sooner? Open an issue and we can prioritize it.


NOTE Library names *must* match the proper Tailwind config name in order to extend the configuration properly.


{
"colors": {
"primary": "#FF0000",
"secondary": "#00FF00",
"tertiary": "#0000FF"
},
"spacing": {
"1": "0.25rem",
"2": "0.5rem",
"3": "0.75rem"
},
"screens": {
"sm": "640px",
"md": "768px",
"lg": "1024px",
"xl": "1280px"
}
}

accepted.name: The DataFace
accepted.description: A digital agency, specializing in data visualization

plugins.tagline: Design to dev with Tailwind in mind

✅ Saves Time – Focus on design while AI handles layer organization.

plugins.name: Interactive Input Fields & Form Prototyping with MagicInput
plugins.description:
Turn any static design into a fully interactive, keyboard-driven prototype, without writing a single line of code

---

MagicInput automates the creation of input fields in your Figma prototypes by:


  1. 🔁 Cloning a base input component or instance
  2. 🔗 Binding values to Figma Variables (value, length, placeholder visibility)
  3. ⌨️ Adding keypress-based reactions for typing, backspace, and more
  4. 🎯 Enabling click-to-focus behavior
  5. 🚀 Generating full keyboard logic with conditional visibility
  6. 🧼 Cleaning up unused variables automatically

---

Whether you're building forms, authentication flows, or search UIs, MagicInput helps simulate realistic input behavior, directly inside Figma.

- Supports:

a–z, A–Z, 0–9, space, backspace, escape, and special characters (!@#$%^&*()_+, etc.)

Perfect for:

  1. UX demos with real input behavior
  2. Usability testing without dev handoff
  3. Interactive form mockups
  4. Keyboard-driven prototype logic


Skip the click-through illusion. Make your inputs feel real.


Try it on your design now and start building smarter Figma prototypes with true input interactivity.


🚧 Beta Disclaimer

We're actively improving MagicInput—some features may still be buggy.

Help us make it better by reporting issues at feedback-form.

plugins.name: Spacing Token Generator
plugins.description:
🔧 What It Does

This Figma plugin helps you automatically generate spacing Tokens based on your preferred scale. Whether you're working with a base-4 or base-8 spacing system—or even a custom multiplier—this tool creates a clean, structured set of spacing tokens to integrate into your design system.



⚙️ How It Works


1. Choose Your Base Grid

Start by selecting your preferred spacing grid:

- 4pt scale (perfect for tighter systems)

- 8pt scale (industry standard for scalable design systems)

- Or choose the "Custom" option to set your own base multiplier (e.g., 5, 10, etc.)


2. Add Multipliers

Define the multipliers you want to generate tokens for.

You can:

- Use the default multipliers (e.g., 1x, 2x, 3x...)

- Add your own custom multipliers for more control over your spacing structure.



3. Generate Spacing Tokens

Click "Generate" and the plugin will automatically:

- Create a new variable collection called "Spacing"

- Generate a full set of iTokens (Figma variables) based on your chosen base and multipliers

- Structure them cleanly and consistently for immediate use across your components


🚀 Why Use It?

- ✅ Save time on repetitive token creation

- ✅ Maintain consistency across your design system

- ✅ Scale your UI spacing logic with precision

- ✅ Easily integrate into Design Tokens pipelines or handoff processes
plugins.tagline: Generate spacing Tokens instantly, right inside Figma.

plugins.name: popcons
plugins.description:
Popcons is a powerful Figma plugin that takes icon customization to the next level.

Unlike conventional icon libraries, Popcons allows you to instantly modify and compare different styles, just like fonts.


Once an icon is imported, you can edit, modify, and adjust it with a single button, eliminating the need for manual replacements.

With support for 6 thickness levels, 4 styles (Line, Solid, Line Color, Full Color), and 3 roundness options, Popcons provides unparalleled flexibility. Additionally, icons can be further enhanced with decorative elements to suit your design needs.


Now, icons can seamlessly adapt to your brand identity and design language.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Key Features of Popcons


✔ One-Click Editing – Instantly modify icons and compare different styles, just like fonts

✔ 6 Thickness Levels – Easily adjust the weight to fit your design

✔ 4 Styles –

* Line – Clean and minimal outline style

* Solid – Bold and filled for strong emphasis

* Line Color – Customizable stroke color for additional versatility

* Full Color – Vibrant and expressive icon style

✔ 3 Roundness Options – Adjust corner roundness to match your aesthetic

✔ Decorative Additions – Enhance icons with additional design elements

✔ Seamless Figma Integration – A smooth, intuitive workflow for designers



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


How Can You Use Popcons?


* UI/UX Design – Maintain a consistent icon style across web and mobile apps

* Brand Identity – Adjust icons to align with your brand’s design system

* Presentations & Infographics – Visually compelling icons for effective communication

* Developer Collaboration – Keep icons flexible and adaptable within a design system

* Quick Style Testing & Comparison – Instantly switch between styles and compare different options



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Why Choose Popcons?


* Font-Like Customization – Modify icons dynamically without replacing them

* Time-Saving Workflow – Instantly compare and apply different styles with a single click

* Design Consistency – Ensure uniformity across your project with structured customization

* Highly Flexible – Adapt icons to fit various use cases effortlessly



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Popcons – Make Your Icons Pop, Instantly.
plugins.tagline: Quick & Easy editable Icon tool

plugins.name: Select Below
plugins.description:
This plugin selects all objects below the selected object. It is useful when creating vertically long web designs, such as when you want to add a section in the middle.


・Targets only objects within the same parent frame

・You can exclude objects with specific layer names or objects that exceed a specified width from the selection in the settings.


選択したオブジェクトより下方向にあるすべてのオブジェクトを選択するプラグインです。縦に長いWebデザインを制作するとき、途中でセクションを追加したくなった時などに活躍します。


・同じ親フレーム内のオブジェクトのみをターゲットにします

・設定で、特定のレイヤー名のオブジェクトや、指定した幅を超えるオブジェクトを選択対象から除外することができます。
plugins.tagline: A plugin that automatically selects all objects below the selected object

plugins.name: IconAutomation
plugins.description:
### **Comprehensive Guide to the IconAutomation Figma Plugin**


#### **Introduction**


**IconAutomation** is a powerful tool designed to streamline and automate the process of publishing icons within Figma. By integrating with GitLab CI, this plugin ensures your icon sets are always up-to-date and consistent across all platforms. Whether you're a designer working on a small project or part of a large team managing complex design systems, IconAutomation saves time and effort while eliminating manual workflows.


This plugin is primarily tailored for enterprise scenarios. Our company aims to build an internal icon library using Figma and GitLab as a replacement for Iconfont, which suffers from the following limitations:


- **Management Complexity**: Managing Iconfont requires multiple accounts and frequent importing/exporting between design files, Iconfont platforms, and code repositories.

- **Icon Accumulation**: Over time, unused icons accumulate and are loaded all at once in projects, preventing on-demand loading.

- **Font-Based Limitations**: Font-based icons may render blurry or pixelated on high-resolution screens.

- **Icon Conflicts**: Conflicts can arise when using multiple Iconfont libraries, leading to incorrect icon displays.


IconAutomation addresses these issues by leveraging SVGs to build a scalable internal icon library. Once configured, updating both the icon library and code repository can be done with a single click. Unlike font-based solutions, SVGs enable granular control over icon usage—only the icons actually used in a project are bundled, preventing unnecessary bloat.


#### **Core Features**


- **One-Click Publishing**: Publish icons directly from Figma with a single action.

- **GitLab Integration**: Seamlessly connect with GitLab CI/CD pipelines for automated workflows.

- **Version Control**: Automatically manage semantic versioning in `package.json`.

- **Diff Generation**: Compare current and historical icons to generate detailed change reports.

- **Branch Automation**: Create feature branches, submit merge requests (MRs), and clean up temporary branches automatically.

- **SVG Optimization**: Optimize icon assets for performance using industry-standard tools.


#### **Prerequisites**


- **GitLab Instance**: A deployed GitLab instance (cloud-based or self-hosted).

- **Template Repository**: Deploy the `react-icons` template repository to your GitLab instance.

- **Figma Client**: Install the IconAutomation plugin via Figma's Community portal.

- **Plugin Configuration**: Configure essential settings as outlined below.


#### **Configuration Guide**


##### **GitLab Settings**


- **Domain**: The URL of your GitLab instance (e.g., `https://gitlab.com`).

- **Project ID**: Found under your repository’s **Settings > General**.

- **Access Token**: Generate a token with `api`, `read_repository`, and `write_repository` scopes from GitLab’s **Profile > Access Tokens**.


##### **Figma Plugin Setup**


1. Install the plugin and grant necessary permissions.

2. Navigate to the plugin settings and input your GitLab domain, project ID, and access token.

3. Validate the connection to ensure seamless integration.


#### **Design Specifications**


##### **Page Naming Conventions**


- Pages intended for publishing **must** include the keyword "icon" (e.g., `product-icons`, `system-icons`).

- Only frames under these pages will be processed by the plugin.


##### **Frame Requirements**


- Frames must be named with one of the following suffixes:

- **Outlined**: For icons with stroke-based designs (e.g., `Navigation-Outlined`).

- **Filled**: For solid-filled icons (e.g., `Actions-Filled`).

- **Colored**: For multi-color icons, further categorized as:

- **Light**: Optimized for light backgrounds.

- **Dark**: Optimized for dark backgrounds.


##### **Icon Layer Rules**


- All icons **must** be Figma components (not frames or groups).

- Verify component status by selecting a layer—the top panel should display "Component."


##### **Naming Standards**


- Use **Upper Camel Case** (e.g., `AlertCircle`, `SettingsGear`).

- Append style suffixes (e.g., `AlertCircleOutlined`, `SettingsGearFilled`).

- Avoid special characters (`-`, `_`, spaces) and numeric suffixes unless intrinsic to the icon’s name (e.g., `Star1` is allowed; `Star 1` is invalid).

- Ensure uniqueness within each category to prevent conflicts.


#### **Automated Workflow**


1. **Repository Setup**: Configure GitLab details in the plugin settings.

2. **Local Validation**:

- The plugin checks for naming compliance, duplicates, and structural errors.

- Invalid icons are flagged with actionable feedback.

3. **Branch Management**:

- A temporary branch (e.g., `figma-update-20231001`) is created from `master`.

- Semantic versioning updates `package.json` (e.g., `1.2.0` → `1.3.0` for minor changes).

4. **Diff Analysis**:

- Compares current icons against the latest `master` commit.

- Generates a report detailing additions, modifications, and deletions.

5. **Asset Export**:

- Exports SVGs via Figma’s API and organizes them into folders (e.g., `/outlined`, `/filled`).

- Applies SVGO optimizations to reduce file size.

6. **Merge Request (MR)**:

- Submits an MR with a standardized title (e.g., `[Figma]: add icons`).

- Auto-merges after passing CI checks (linting, build tests).


#### **Best Practices**


- **Consistent Naming**: Adhere strictly to naming conventions to avoid validation failures.

- **Modular Design**: Build icons as reusable components with standardized dimensions (e.g., 24x24px).

- **Version Tracking**: Maintain a `CHANGELOG.md` to document icon updates and deprecations.

- **Performance Checks**: Audit SVG complexity to ensure optimal rendering (e.g., simplify paths for small icons).


#### **Example Scenarios**


##### **Scenario 1: Updating an Icon Set**


1. Add new icons to the `Actions-Filled` frame in Figma.

2. Run the plugin to validate and generate diffs.

3. Submit an MR to deploy changes to production.


##### **Scenario 2: Migrating Legacy Iconfont Icons**


1. Import existing Iconfont SVGs into a `Legacy-Outlined` frame.

2. Use the plugin to publish them as SVGs and update project imports.


#### **Troubleshooting**


| Issue | Solution |

| ------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

| **Naming Errors** | Check for invalid characters or duplicates using the plugin’s validation tool. |

| **Merge Conflicts** | Resolve conflicts manually in GitLab before re-running the plugin. |

| **API Timeouts** | Increase timeout thresholds in GitLab CI settings or split large icon sets. |

| **SVG Rendering Issues** | Convert strokes to outlines and simplify complex paths in Figma. |


#### **Future Roadmap**


- [ ] **GitHub Integration**: Support publishing to GitHub repositories.

- [ ] **Change Preview**: Display a summary of icon changes before publishing.

- [ ] **Enhanced Error Handling**: Provide contextual error messages with resolution steps.

- [ ] **Progress Tracking**: Add a visual progress bar for long-running tasks.


#### **Additional Resources**


- **Figma Documentation**: [Figma Help Center](https://help.figma.com)

- **GitLab CI/CD Guide**: [GitLab CI/CD Documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/)

- **Community Support**: Join discussions on Figma’s [Community Forum](https://forum.figma.com).
plugins.tagline: This is a plugin that combines Figma + GitLab to achieve automated publication of an icon library.

- **Modular Design**: Build icons as reusable components with standardized dimensions (e.g., 24x24px).

- **Version Tracking**: Maintain a `CHANGELOG.md` to document icon updates and deprecations.

- **Performance Checks**: Audit SVG complexity to ensure optimal rendering (e.g., simplify paths for small icons).


#### **Example Scenarios**


##### **Scenario 1: Updating an Icon Set**


1. Add new icons to the `Actions-Filled` frame in Figma.

2. Run the plugin to validate and generate diffs.

3. Submit an MR to deploy changes to production.


##### **Scenario 2: Migrating Legacy Iconfont Icons**


1. Import existing Iconfont SVGs into a `Legacy-Outlined` frame.

2. Use the plugin to publish them as SVGs and update project imports.


#### **Troubleshooting**


| Issue | Solution |

| ------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

| **Naming Errors** | Check for invalid characters or duplicates using the plugin’s validation tool. |

| **Merge Conflicts** | Resolve conflicts manually in GitLab before re-running the plugin. |

| **API Timeouts** | Increase timeout thresholds in GitLab CI settings or split large icon sets. |

| **SVG Rendering Issues** | Convert strokes to outlines and simplify complex paths in Figma. |


#### **Future Roadmap**


- [ ] **GitHub Integration**: Support publishing to GitHub repositories.

- [ ] **Change Preview**: Display a summary of icon changes before publishing.

- [ ] **Enhanced Error Handling**: Provide contextual error messages with resolution steps.

- [ ] **Progress Tracking**: Add a visual progress bar for long-running tasks.


#### **Additional Resources**


- **Figma Documentation**: [Figma Help Center](https://help.figma.com)

- **GitLab CI/CD Guide**: [GitLab CI/CD Documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/)

- **Community Support**: Join discussions on Figma’s [Community Forum](https://forum.figma.com).
122759.tagline: This is a plugin that combines Figma + GitLab to achieve automated publication of an icon library.

plugins.name: Tappy
plugins.description:
Tappy

Tappyは、Figma上で選択中のオブジェクトの大きさを取得し、それをタップする操作が成功する確率を算出するプラグインです。


使い方

Tappyのウィンドウで、iPhoneの機種名をメニューから選択してください。Figma上でオブジェクトを選択すると、指定したiPhone上に表示したときの大きさ（ピクセル単位とmm単位）、およびそのオブジェクトをタップするときの成功確率が表示されます。メニューに含まれていない画面サイズの機種を指定したい場合は、「画面の大きさ」欄に直接ピクセル数を入力してください。末尾に記載の利用規約も併せてご確認の上ご使用ください。


タップの成功確率の算出基準

タップ成功率（SR）は以下の式をもとに計算されます。

SR= erf[W/{2×sqrt(2) ×σ_x}]×erf[H/{2×sqrt(2) ×σ_y}]

erfは誤差関数、Wはボタンの横幅、Hはボタンの縦幅です。

σ_xとσ_yはそれぞれタップ座標の軸の分散と軸の分散であり、以下の式をもとに計算されます。

(σ_x)^2=α_x×W^2+(σ_ax)^2、 (σ_y)^2=α_y×H^2+(σ_ay)^2

α_x、σ_ax、α_y、σ_ayは回帰定数です。

より詳しい理論は論文(https://doi.org/10.1145/3567732)の2章と3章や、Tech Blog（https://techblog.yahoo.co.jp/entry/2021120930233778/）をご参照ください。

Tappyは 「非利き手でスマートフォンを持ち、利き手の人差し指でボタンをタップする場合」を想定しています。


Tappy利用規約

Tappy（以下「本プラグイン」といいます）のご利用に際しては、LINEヤフー共通利用規約（https://www.lycorp.co.jp/ja/company/terms/）およびプライバシーポリシー（https://www.lycorp.co.jp/ja/company/privacypolicy/）に加えて、本利用規約が適用されます。


1. 本プラグインの概要

本プラグインは、お客様がFigma上で作成しているアプリの表示画面について、当該アプリをスマートフォンで閲覧する場合における、次の事項を表示するプラグインです。

・画面上のタップできる箇所（ボタン、アイコン、ハイパーリンク等）の大きさ

・当社が別に定める基準 に従い算出した、上記の箇所に関するタップの成功確率


2.免責事項等

・当社は、本プラグインの利用または利用不能、その他本サービスに関連してお客様に生じた一切の損害について責任を負わないものとします。

・当社は、お客様が本プラグインを通じて得た情報等の確実性、完全性、正確性、有用性、特定目的への適合性等について一切保証いたしません。

・当社は、お客様の本プラグインのFigmaにおける利用が、Figma社がFigmaに関して定める利用規約等に抵触しないことを保証するものではございません。必ずお客様にて当該利用規約等をご確認のうえ、本プラグインをご利用くださいますようお願いいたします。


（2024年10月7日制定）

plugins.description:
A plugin that just plucks everything from one side of the cursor. Great for making room for that extra page in a flow.


Right click context menu, or simplest ctrl+, cmd+, search for 'pluck'.


Known issue:

If you hold down the right mouse button as you go through the menus, the selection will be wrong, since you moved the mouse sideways. Click and release, then go through the menus.


Will only select items that are frames or layers on the canvas.


Or do the quick action menu: ctrl/cmd+,

plugins.name: Text Style Creator
plugins.description:
What This Plugin Does

  1. Creates local text styles from any selected text layer
  2. Preserves all typography variable connections (font family, size, weight, etc.)
  3. Automatically finds and applies styles to all matching text layers in the current page


How to Use

  1. Select any text layer that you want to create a style from
  2. Run the plugin


The text style will be named using the content of the selected text layer

The plugin will automatically apply the new style to all text layers with matching properties


Key Features

Supports all typography variables

Batch processing: select multiple text layers to create multiple styles at once

Intelligent matching: finds all text layers with identical properties


Preserves variable connections for:

  1. Font family
  2. Font size
  3. Font style
  4. Font weight
  5. Line height
  6. Letter spacing
  7. Paragraph spacing
  8. Paragraph indent


Note: Make sure your text layers have the desired properties before creating styles, as these will be preserved in the created style.
plugins.tagline: Create local text styles, preserving variable bindings and auto-applying to matching layers.

plugins.name: Generators & Sync Styles
plugins.description:
Create and Synchronize Local Color and Text Styles


Effortlessly create local color styles from selected frames and rectangles, while also generating global text styles from selected text layers. This plugin streamlines your design process by ensuring consistency across your project.


How it Works:


Selection: Simply select any frames, rectangles, or text layers within your Figma document.

Style Generation: Run the plugin to automatically generate local color styles based on the fill colors of the selected objects. For text layers, global text styles will be created based on the selected text properties.


Synchronization: The plugin intelligently synchronizes identical elements by matching both colors and text styles. Any duplicate styles will be updated accordingly, maintaining a cohesive look throughout your design.


With a clean interface and efficient workflow, this plugin enhances your design efficiency and style management.


Important!

The name of each color style will match the corresponding layer name, while the name of each text style will correspond to the selected text layer name. You can use a "/" in either layer name to organize your styles into groups. All styles will be arranged from largest to smallest based on their size.
plugins.tagline: Effortless style creation and synchronization for your designs!

plugins.name: Paint Mixer - Try for FREE
plugins.description:
Paint Mixer allows you to blend two colors just like in real life, using Kubelka & Munk algorithm to predict how light interacts with mixed pigments under natural light for the most authentic results. Learn More from this video.


Features

  1. Accurately mix two colors using the Kubelka & Munk theory.
  2. Apply the mixed color as a fill or stroke to Figma layers.
  3. Create a 9-step gradient layer and linear-fill layer from the start and end colors.


How to Use

  1. Select the end color from the palette box below.
  2. Rotate the handle clockwise to gradually mix the start color with the end color. Rotate counterclockwise to unmix.
  3. Click the hex code to copy color.
  4. Hover on the dropdown to show more actions (see image 2).
  5. Double-click one of the palettes to change its color.


Tips

  1. Rotate two full revolutions (720°) to completely turn into the end color.
  2. Click 3 dots at the bottom to show more options.
  3. Grabbing the handle further from the center of the wheel gives you more precise control.


Pricing

  1. 10 free actions with full access to all features. Actions include using the mixed color and opening the plugin.
  2. Unlock unlimited access for a one-time purchase.


Credits

  1. This plugin uses spectral.js to handle color mixing which is licensed under the MIT License.
  2. Inspiration from Paper app for iPad.
plugins.tagline: Realistic color blending using Kubelka-Munk theory

plugins.name: Navigator
plugins.description:
Navigator is your personal navigation assistant in Figma. It allows you to bookmark up to 4 frames across your project for instant access. It supports across page access as well.


Navigator is perfect for designers working on large projects, enabling efficient navigation and improved productivity. Leap through your designs with ease and speed up your workflow today!




HOW TO:

Select a frame and click "Add Link" to bookmark it

Use the saved links to instantly navigate to your bookmarked frames

Clear individual links or all links as needed

Toggle the UI to keep your workspace clean
plugins.tagline: Jump between key designs quickly, streamlining workflow in large projects. Save time, stay focused!

plugins.name: Slice by guides
plugins.description:
You can use this plugin to create slices along horizontal Guidelines. This is a convenient tool for further export of the sliced ​​layout.


Instructions:

1) Select the Frame that you want to divide into slices.

2) Add Guidelines, along which the division into slices will be carried out in the future.

3) Run the plugin.


The result of the plugin's work is the "Slice" elements added in the selected Frame, which can be used for export. To do this, simply select these slices and export them in a format convenient for you.
plugins.tagline: Creates slices inside a Frame along horizontal Guidelines

plugins.name: Section Marker
plugins.description:
Section Marker streamlines your design process by allowing you to instantly insert labeled frames onto your canvas. With a simple UI, you can select predefined frame sizes and headings to create clear sections within your projects. Ideal for organizing content, marking boundaries, or drafting layouts, Section Marker adds a descriptive heading to each frame for easy navigation and reference. Use Section Marker to keep your design process organized and efficient.


Features:

  • Insert labeled frames with a single click.
  • Customize frame sizes to fit your design needs.
  • Enjoy a minimal and intuitive user interface.
  • Save time with quick-access options for common frame types.


How to Use:

  • Select the type of frame from the plugin UI.
  • Click 'Create' to add the frame to your canvas.
  • Drag the frame to your desired location or let it auto-position at your viewport's center.
plugins.tagline: Instantly insert and label section frames in your designs.

plugins.name: tinyzine
plugins.description:
tinyzine is a plugin that simplifies zine creation, making the process more intuitive and enjoyable. Whether you're crafting a folded zine or a booklet, tinyzine provides an array of features to enhance your design workflow.


Features:

  1. Create: Effortlessly generate frames and layouts for folded or booklet zines. Customize everything from page size, name, and guides to page count, background, and text color.
  2. Layout: Quickly create a print-ready booklet layout with minimal effort by simply selecting frames sequentially.
  3. Rename: Automatically rename frames to save time, allowing you to generate layouts more efficiently.


Ideal for artists, designers, and DIY creators aiming to bring their zine ideas to life with ease
plugins.tagline: a plugin to streamline your zine creation process

plugins.name: Figmattack
plugins.description:
Figmattack: Your Ultimate Figma Learning Adventure Starts Here! 🚀


Welcome to the OPEN BETA of Figmattack, the first-ever Figma LMS plugin designed specifically for designers of all levels. Whether you're just starting out or you're a seasoned pro, Figmattack offers an exciting and interactive way to sharpen your skills, take on new challenges, and grow as a designer—all within Figma!


Why Try Figmattack?


1. Gamified Learning Stages 🎮

Explore dungeons with progressively challenging stages—Easy, Medium, and Hard. Each dungeon tests your design skills with hands-on Exercise Stages, engaging Quizzes, and fast-paced Timebox Stages. It’s not just learning, it’s an adventure!


2. Personalized Onboarding

When you start, Figmattack adapts to your current level—beginner, intermediate, or expert. You’ll get personalized challenges that help you improve exactly where you need it most.


3. Curated Knowledge Base 📚

Access a handpicked selection of design resources and insights to support your learning journey. Whether you’re tackling a new concept or refreshing your knowledge, our knowledge base is there to guide you.


Coming Soon to Figmattack!


We’re in OPEN BETA, and that means new features are on the horizon:


  1. Leaderboard: Compete with other designers, track your progress, and rise to the top.
  2. Learning Paths: Follow structured paths that guide you from beginner to expert.
  3. Community Features: Join challenges, share tips, and collaborate with other designers within Figmattack.


Join the Figmattack Community on Discord!


We're constantly improving, and we want you to help shape Figmattack. If you encounter any bugs, have ideas for improvements, or just want to connect with other designers on the same journey, we’d love to hear from you!


Join Our Discord and be part of the growing Figmattack community! Share your experience, give feedback, and help us build the future of design learning together.


Get Started with Figmattack Today!


Don’t wait—join the adventure now and start leveling up your design skills inside Figma! This is your chance to experience Figmattack in its early stages, give your feedback, and watch as new features and stages are added in real-time.


Install Figmattack on Figma and dive into your first design challenge now!


Disclaimer: As we're in OPEN BETA, not all features are available yet, and there may be bugs or areas for improvement. Your feedback is crucial in making Figmattack the best learning tool for designers, so don’t hesitate to reach out and share your thoughts!

accepted.name: Sacha Perathoner
accepted.description: Looking for the perfect fit between Users Needs & Business Objectives.

plugins.tagline: Unlock your design potential

plugins.name: Embedded Wizard Connect for Figma
plugins.description:
Export Figma Designs to Embedded Wizard Studio

Embedded Wizard Connect for Figma simplifies the workflow between designers and embedded developers. Instead of recreating designs from scratch in Embedded Wizard Studio, you can now start with GUI layouts from Figma and bring the design to life more quickly.


Benefits:

-Template-free flexibility: Designers can work freely in Figma without being restricted to rigid templates.

-Simplified Workflow: Embedded Wizard converts Figma designs into implementable code suited for embedded systems, eliminating manual efforts and reducing development time.

-Uncomplicated Design Updates: Save time by reimporting updated Figma Designs with just a few clicks


Getting started:

Check out the full documentation for best practices

Get to know Embedded Wizard on our website.


About Embedded Wizard:

Embedded Wizard is TARA Systems’ award-winning solution for developing embedded graphical user interfaces (GUIs).

accepted.name: TARA Systems GmbH
accepted.description: TARA Systems is an independent software company. Embedded Wizard is its award-winning solution for creating graphical user interfaces for embedded systems.

plugins.tagline: Bring your creativity pixel prefect to your embedded device

117485.release_notes:
Live Skew Angle Display – See real-time skew values in degrees next to sliders.

✅ Cancel Button – Resets all changes and closes the plugin without applying.
✅ Auto-Reset on Close – If you exit without applying, everything goes back to normal.
✅ Smoother UI & Performance – Instant skew preview without unwanted transformations.

🔥 Now you have full control over horizontal & vertical skew without losing your original design!

Let me know if you need any more improvements. Enjoy! 🚀
117485.tagline: Skew Your Designs with Ease—No Fuss, Just Fun!
